Package edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre.hg

Class ActionNode

java.lang.Object
edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre.hg.Node
edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre.hg.CostNode
edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre.hg.EventNode
edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre.hg.ActionNode
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<CostNode>
public class ActionNode extends EventNode
An event node that represents an action. An action node does not automatically have a finite CostNode.getCost() once its precondition has a finite cost; rather, once an action's precondition has a finite cost the action is added to a list of actions that will be assigned a finite cost next time the heuristic graph's HeuristicGraph.extend() method is called. When that method is called, all waiting action nodes will be assigned the cost of their preconditions plus one, where the plus one represents the additional effort of taking that action.
Author:
Stephen G. Ware

  • Method Details

    • setCost

      public boolean setCost(double cost)
      Description copied from class: CostNode
      Sets the cost of this node's logical formula being true. The node's cost will only be updated if the given cost is less than the current cost.
      Overrides:
      setCost in class EventNode
      Parameters:
      cost - the new cost for this node's logical expression to be true
      Returns:
      true if the cost was updated, or false if this node's state did not change

    • notify

      protected void notify(Node node, Value value, double cost)
      Description copied from class: Node
      This method is called when some other node in the graph which is important to this node takes on a new value. This method has a variety of uses depending on the type of node, but it is usually called when this node might need to be updated based on an update to another related node.
      Overrides:
      notify in class Node
      Parameters:
      node - the node which took on a new value
      value - the new value taken on by the node
      cost - the cost of that node taking on that value
